post_text: We will #neverforget911
shared_text:
YOUTUBE.COM
9 11 NEVER FORGET TODD BEAMER : FLIGHT 93

Danny Massey
September 11 at 4:39 PM ·

I think each of us can remember exactly where we were when we learned about the terrorist attacks on the World Trade Centers on Sept. 11, 2001. I was in a classroom in E wing at Brazoswood HS. We just had TVs mounted in our classrooms and students and staff were glued to the news in disbelief. One of my favorite stories of heroism from 9/11 is of Todd Beamer. He was a passenger on UA flight 93 that was headed to Washington D.C to do more damage. Todd and other passengers figured out what was happening and overtook the cockpit and terrorist, with the now famous words of “Let’s Roll!” This courageous act of bravery undoubtedly saved many Americans lives. We will never forget!

Given the uncertainty of Tropical Storm Laura in the Gulf of Mexico, we have determined it is in the best interest of our students and staff to take action and close schools Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday. The path of this storm has changed several times over the last few days and is anticipated to strengthen. We encourage everyone to take precautions and use this time to prepare for the potential heavy winds and rain that may impact our area.

There will be no classes for virtual at home learners or at school learners on these closure dates. We will continue monitoring the Gulf of Mexico and inform parents and staff of any additional closures depending on the impact to our area, through our mass call out system, BISD social media, local and Houston area news stations. Thank you and stay safe!

BISD Mourns the Loss of Our Coach Bonner

Brazosport ISD is saddened by the sudden passing of a beloved member of our BISD family, Alford Bonner. Coach Bonner, a proud BISD graduate himself, loved his school district and valued building positive relationships with students.

Alford impacted the lives of so many students over his 19 year career in BISD through his continual encouragement and concern for all areas of their development and growth. Coach Bonner was an inspiration to the students at Grady Rasco Middle School and a role model for the young men that he coached at Clute Intermediate School.

Alford Bonner was so much more than a coach to his students and players, and more than a coworker to his colleagues; Alford was family, and this family will miss his fist-bumps, his smile and his words of encouragement.

Our thoughts are with Alford’s family, friends, students and colleagues. You will be missed, Coach.

shared_text:
Brazoswood High School Official Site
May 9 at 2:38 PM ·

CONGRATULATIONS to our newest Assistant Principal - Sonja Cooper
This is Mrs.Cooper’s fourth year in BISD and at Brazoswood High School where she taught German and served as the Foreign Language Department Head. Mrs. Cooper received her Bachelor of Arts in Elementary Education from Shepherd University in Shepherdstown WV. She completed her Masters of Education at the University of St. Thomas in St. Paul, Minnesota with a concentration in Gifted and Talented Education. After moving to Texas, Mrs. Cooper received her Principal Certification from Lamar University in Beaumont. This is Mrs. Cooper’s 11th year in education. She has experience teaching at the elementary, middle, and high school level. Besides teaching German at the High School level, Mrs.Cooper has taught first grade and middle school English. Mrs. Cooper was born and raised in a small town called Seligenstadt outside of Frankfurt/Germany. Before getting into education, Mrs. Cooper worked for several years for Lufthansa German Airlines.

In the midst of these unprecedented times, we want bring out this great news! Congratulations Lanier Middle School Freeport for being named a Professional Learning Community!

“The concepts of being a Professional Learning Community have become sustainable best practices that the entire school has an intrinsic investment in,” said Lanier Principal Bridgette Percle. “The collective culture of collaboration is now our way of life. As a result, Lanier is now a state “Recognized” campus to be proud of with a continued “All In” focus of continuous improvement for “All” students.”

Schools are recognized based on strict criteria, including demonstration of a commitment to PLC concepts, implementation of these concepts for at least three years, and clear evidence of improved student learning and outcomes over that period. We are proud of these amazing students and staff!

BISD Parents, if you have not been receiving calls, emails and/or text regarding school closures and other important messages from the district, please log in to Parent Self Serve (link below) and make sure that the first person listed has an email, a home phone and a cell number entered. In an emergency we will use all of these methods to contact the primary/first contact. If you wish to receive texts you must opt in by sending a text from the cell phone on file to 67587 with the word Yes.

If the first person’s contact information is listed and you are still not receiving communications, send us a message through Just Ask! www.brazosportisd.net/community/Just_Ask. You may have previously opted out of the system, and we can get you opted back in upon request.

Together we will make this work during this unprecedented time. Thank you, and as always, be safe!

We will continue to be in communication with the Brazoria County Health Department, the CDC and state authorities regarding the COVID-19 outbreak and provide updates to families as warranted.

Take Time To Read is being practiced in Lodges all across the state. Members of Lake Jackson Masonic Lodge #1317 put together over 2,000 packets for students in grades K-2nd. Pictured above with our Elementary librarians is the current Master of Lake Jackson Lodge #1317, Jason Martin.

post_text: Seniors attended an “After The Fire” assembly. Alvaro Llanos and Shawn Simons are two survivors of the deadly Seton Hall dormitory fire.
shared_text:
Brazosport High School
February 20 at 9:20 PM ·

Our Seniors attended an “After The Fire” assembly today.

Alvaro Llanos and Shawn Simons are two survivors of the deadly Seton Hall dormitory fire. Alvaro and Shawn present about their ordeal of being college burn survivors nationally at many colleges and high schools across the country. They also speak at fire safety training or firefighting seminars.

Their motive is to be advocates for fire safety and prevention so that no other students will have to endure the pain that they suffered. Also, they strive to be the voice of many burn survivors across the country who may feel "trapped in their new skin." They inspire to motivate students and professionals that life will give you many obstacles. It's how you overcome those obstacles by drawing strength, knowledge and motivation from those around you and from within. #BISDpride #Bportpride
